intro: Eichlerago, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often cultivated for its ornamental value. Eichlerago thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
